title: Make the app use a dark theme by default

requirements.text: Update the application so the UI is presented in a dark theme by default (including signed-in pages and signed-out landing), using the existing Tailwind CSS variable-based theme system and the existing ThemeProvider setup.

quotes: Aisa dark theme me bana do

acceptanceCriteria: On first load in a fresh browser session, the app renders in dark mode without requiring the user to change OS/system theme settings.
The dark theme applies consistently across the authenticated shell (header/footer/layout), dashboard, project editor, and dialogs.
No user-facing text is changed to non-English as part of this update.

requirements.text: Ensure the public project page (/p/$projectId) renders correctly in dark mode and remains consistent with the app’s non-blue/non-purple primary visual direction by updating its theme styling to align with the existing design tokens (bg-background/text-foreground, card/muted/primary) rather than hardcoded gray/purple classes.

quotes: Aisa dark theme me bana do

acceptanceCriteria: When a published project uses the 'dark' theme, the public page has correct contrast for text, links, and prose content.
The public page does not use a purple/pink-based 'custom' background styling; it follows the app’s established palette direction.
Links and markdown-rendered content remain readable and visually consistent with the rest of the app theme tokens.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any sources under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Keep backend architecture as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Building a new theming system from scratch (use the existing Tailwind CSS variables and ThemeProvider).
Changing project data models or introducing migrations.
